Leonardo da Vinci: I would bring Leonardo da Vinci back to life because he was a polymath and one of the most brilliant minds of all time. He was a painter, sculptor, architect, scientist, inventor, musician, mathematician, engineer, inventor, anatomist, geologist, cartographer, botanist, and writer. He is considered one of the greatest painters of all time, with works such as the Mona Lisa and The Last Supper. He also made significant contributions to fields such as engineering, anatomy, and mathematics. With his incredible knowledge and skills, I would love to see what he would create and discover if he were alive today.

Marie Curie: I would bring Marie Curie back to life because she was a pioneering scientist who made groundbreaking discoveries in the field of radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and the first person to win two Nobel Prizes in different fields (Physics in 1903 and Chemistry in 1911). Her work laid the foundation for the development of nuclear energy and nuclear medicine. I would love to see what she would discover and achieve if she were alive today.

Mahatma Gandhi: I would bring Mahatma Gandhi back to life because he was a leader who inspired millions of people around the world with his nonviolent approach to civil rights and social justice. He played a key role in India's struggle for independence from British rule and is known for his leadership in the civil rights movement in the United States. I would love to see what he would accomplish if he were alive today and how he would address the challenges facing our world.

William Shakespeare: I would bring William Shakespeare back to life because he was one of the greatest writers in the English language. He wrote 38 plays, 154 sonnets, two long narrative poems, and other verses, and his works are still performed and studied today. His plays and sonnets explore themes such as love, betrayal, revenge, power, and mortality, and they continue to be relevant and beloved by people of all ages. I would love to see what he would write and create if he were alive today.
Martin Luther King Jr.: I would bring Martin Luther King Jr. back to life because he was a leader who inspired millions of people around the world
